page.title: 04LONGSTANTON PARISH COUNCIL
page.content: The Parish Council in Longstanton has nine members at present, each elected by the Parishioners for a four year period. The monthly Council meetings are open to the public, and there is an annual Parish Meeting. The Council's{main purpose}is to identify the village's needs and to represent them to the appropriate authority. It maintains parish amenities such as the bus shelters and the Recreation Ground. It raises money for this by levying an annual rate.{ {Recent concerns}have included litter, dogs fouling public areas, the removal of trees and access to Rights of Way. Children's play equipment on the Recreation Ground has needed attention recently, and vandalism there has been a problem. A new free Parish Guide has been produced and distributed.
